page.title: 01FANS FARM
page.content: The majority of the area of the block is occupied by Fans and Darlingfield farms, two tenanted farms belonging to Mellerstain Estate. To the north lies the farm of West Marriston, one of whose principle enterprises as the rearing of chickens. Otherwise the land is arable with intensively managed grassland for rearing beef cattle and sheep. The population is limited to some 15 families who live and work on the farms. There are two large coniferous plantations for the production of softwood timber, and a number of coniferous and deciduous shelter belts to shelter livestock and farm buildings. The ground rises in the centre of the block to the highest point in the area, Fans Hill, an open grass hill of 246m high, which has a triangulation point on it. The block is well served by a variety of roads
